Event.name: Social_event_individuals
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants. Additionally, participants in this frame are expressed separately, as <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen>. Note the difference between this frame and Social_event_collective, where participants are grouped into one collective grammatical constituent and FE.
<ex><fex name="Party_1">I</fex> <t>went out with</t> <fex name="Party_2">him</fex> <fex name="ti">on Friday</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Party_1
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Party_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in the social event. <fen>Party_1</fen> can be one or more individuals.</def-root>

Arg.name: Party_2
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Party_2</fen> is the grammatically less prominent participant in the social event. <fen>Party_2</fen> can be one or more individuals.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the social event is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the social event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the social event occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: go out with.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to participate in a social event with (someone)
